Its meaning in effect is this: the general character of furtum consists in intentionally dealing with a res mobilis in a wrongful manner, and usually the res is aliena, whether the intention be to appropriate ownersbip in it (ipsius rei) or merely to use it in an unauthorized manner (usus); but it is possible to commit theft on property of one's own, though to do this it is as a rule essential that the property should be in tbe lawful possession of another person, the in- tention being to dispossess the latter (possessionis).
